Header: Protesters clash violently with security forces in Santiago
Content: Chileans took to the streets of Santiago, pouring by the thousands into plazas and clashing violently with security forces as the protests that have shaken the country showed no signs of letting up.Security forces in armored vehicles dispersed the crowds with tear gas and water cannons and protesters responded by hurling rocks and paint at the vehicles.Unrest in Chile continues after more than a week of riots, arson and protests over inequality that have resulted in at least 18 dead and 7,000 arrested. Chilean businesses lost more than $1.4 billion. The cityâ€™s metro suffered nearly $400 million in damages.Protests over a hike in metro fares spun out of control earlier this month, prompting Pinera to pledge sweeping social and economic reforms, and to upend his cabinet.
